Detailed Description

Contains functions for writing and manipulating star mode parameters.

Function Documentation

◆ bumpoutputs_2_MatrixXd_with_aj()

MatrixXd bumpoutputs_2_MatrixXd_with_aj ( Params_synthetic_star  params,
double  inc 
)

Converts synthetic star parameters to a matrix of mode parameters with a specific inclination.

This function takes synthetic star parameters and converts them into a matrix of mode parameters. The mode parameters are organized based on their degree and include additional parameters such as asymmetry and inclination.

Parameters
paramsThe synthetic star parameters.
incThe inclination angle.
Returns
The matrix of mode parameters.

◆ copy_cfg()

void copy_cfg ( const std::string &  filename,
const std::string &  outputFilename,
bool  append 
)

Copies the contents of one file to another.

This function copies the contents of the input file to the output file. It removes trailing white space and tabulation from each line and excludes lines starting with "#". The copied contents are written to the output file.

Parameters
filenameThe path of the input file.
outputFilenameThe path of the output file.
appendA flag indicating whether to append to an existing file or create a new file.

◆ file_read_error()

void file_read_error ( std::string  file_out)

Displays an error message when a file cannot be read.

This function is called when there is an error opening a file for reading. It displays an error message and exits the program.

Parameters
file_outThe file that could not be read.

◆ write_range_modes()

void write_range_modes ( Cfg_synthetic_star  cfg_star,
Params_synthetic_star  params,
std::string  output_file,
bool  append 
)

Writes range modes to a file.

This function takes the configuration and parameters of a synthetic star and writes the range modes to a file. The range modes include the numax, minimum and maximum frequencies, and the position of the curvature for the 2nd order equation of frequencies.

Parameters
cfg_starThe configuration of the synthetic star.
paramsThe parameters of the synthetic star.
output_fileThe output file path.
appendA flag indicating whether to append to an existing file or create a new file.

◆ write_star_l1_roots()

void write_star_l1_roots ( Params_synthetic_star  params_out,
std::string  file_out,
bool  append 
)

Writes l=1 p and g modes to a file.

This function takes the parameters of a synthetic star and writes the l=1 p and g modes to a file. The p and g modes are used for the mixed mode computation.

Parameters
params_outThe parameters of the synthetic star.
file_outThe output file path.
appendA flag indicating whether to append to an existing file or create a new file.

◆ write_star_mode_params_asympt_model()

void write_star_mode_params_asympt_model ( MatrixXd  mode_params,
std::string  file_out,
bool  append 
)

Writes star mode parameters to a file in a specific format.

This function takes a matrix of mode parameters and writes them to a file. The mode parameters are written in a specific format, including headers and labels for each parameter.

Parameters
mode_paramsThe matrix of mode parameters to be written.
file_outThe output file path.
appendA flag indicating whether to append to an existing file or create a new file.

◆ write_star_noise_params()

void write_star_noise_params ( MatrixXd  noise_params,
std::string  file_out,
bool  append 
)

Writes star noise parameters to a file.

This function takes a matrix of noise parameters and writes them to a file. The noise parameters are organized based on their degree and include additional information such as H0, tau_0, p0, H1, tau_1, p1, and N0.

Parameters
noise_paramsThe matrix of noise parameters.
file_outThe output file path.
appendA flag indicating whether to append to an existing file or create a new file.
